jde.util
Class MultiValueMap

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap
          jde.util.MultiValueMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map
public class MultiValueMap
extends java.util.HashMap

A HashMap subclass which adds multiple values with the same key to a List of values. Single values remain single keys, obviating the need to cart around single-element Lists. Constructor Detail

MultiValueMap

public MultiValueMap()
Method Detail

getAsList

public java.util.List getAsList(java.lang.Object key)
Convenience method for retrieving the value for key as a List, even when there is only a single value for that key in the map. The EMPTY_LIST is returned when no value is found for key making null checks unnecessary.

Parameters:
key - an Object value
Returns:
a List value

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
inserts value into the map for key as a single element or, if values already exist, as an entry in key's list.

Specified by:
put in interface java.util.Map
Overrides:
put in class java.util.HashMap
Parameters:
key - an Object value
value - an Object value
Returns:
null
